profileAlternative.name: Jesse Krasnostein
profileAlternative.headline: Product Manager, Cloud at MongoDB
profileAlternative.summary:
After getting multiple ventures off the ground and growing them into thriving businesses, Jesse is now focussed on building out the Growth team at MongoDB. A skilled product manager at heart, he is bringing his innate ability to simplify complex processes and deep customer empathy to a rapidly growing part of MongoDB's business, MongoDB Atlas.

Jesse is most at home when his days are filled with a multitude of tasks: from white-boarding and ideation, diving deep into product usage metrics, talking with customers, figuring out bugs and issues with engineering, or working on the launch strategy for a new product or feature.

Prior to MongoDB, Jesse was focussed on building Manner.io, which went on become one of the most densely populated online commercial insurance marketplaces in Australia, listing risk appetite from the top insurance carriers and commercial underwriters in the country. Prior to that, he was managing a large team across 3 offices at Spotad. In addition to owning two separate product lines, Jesse’s team was uber successful in massively scaling revenue and they did an unbelievable job at optimizing gross margin.

Jesse brings both a creative and analytical perspective to every task he works on and he is not afraid of getting down and dirty. Whether it be figuring out how best to segment customer behavior, scraping logs to find bugs, or meeting face-to-face with customers to solicit feedback, his energy and tenacious approach has proven to be his strength in guiding the success of products he has developed.

He is now looking for opportunities to mentor and advise startups (early through to growth stage) and entrepreneurs on product development, growth, and marketing.

Jesse is interested in data, edtech, fintech, health, or SaaS offerings, as well as data and AI companies. He is also open to consulting and advisory positions with startups looking for additional product support, especially NFPs.

positions.title: MongoDB
positions.description: First Growth PM focussing on new user experience, activation, and engagement.

positions.title:
Title
Product Manager, Cloud
positions.description: First Growth PM focussing on new user experience, activation, and engagement.

positions.title: Head of Product & Software Engineer
positions.description:
Co-founder of Manner. Developed proprietary B2B matchmaker for commercial insurance in Australia. Managed and performed all duties related to Software Engineering and Product Management, while working closely with our customers to launch in July 2017.

Tech stack: Rails, Node.js, MongoDB, AWS
Tools: Git, JIRA, Confluence
…
see more

positions.title: General Manager
positions.description:
Operations leader and GM for North America during a period of rapid expansion. Product owner for two core systems (business intelligence and campaign management platform). Delivered 25x MRR growth over 20 months by focussing on product performance, analytics, and customer success. Hired/managed team of 15 accounts, operations, and analyst staff. Customers included two largest ride sharing companies, premier online travel destinations, and other major venture backed businesses.

Previous roles:
Head of Operations (July 2015 - October 2015)
Operations Lead (April 2015 - July 2015)
…
see more

educations.title: University of Technology, Sydney
educations.degree: Bachelor of Business (Finance) and Bachelor of Science (IT)

given.text:
I had the pleasure to work with Jesse for over a year at Spotad. Jesse came in as the first employee in the US. At the time, we had little in place in terms of systems and processes. As the company was rapidly growing, Jesse played a pivotal role in nearly all aspects of the company's operation. From product to account management to operations to basically anything in between, Jesse was a vital part of the team and the growth of the company. Jesse has a very well tempered manner to him that makes it easy for virtually any human being to get along with. Jesse always comes in with a good attitude, and is the kind of person that looks at a problem with the approach of "how am I going to solve it?" vs. "this can't be done." Overall, I think I speak for the entire organization in saying I very much enjoyed the time I spent with Jesse at Spotad; and I do hope one day that our paths do cross again. He stays a good friend to this day. Feel free to contact me directly if you would like any more specifics on Jesse's time at Spotad.
…
See more

Jesse is an excellent analyst, who tackles problems from different angles and provides tailored solutions. Not only does he possess an outstanding technical skillset, but he also understands the value of networks and affiliation and has outstanding stakeholder management abilities. Jesse would be an asset to any team.

received.text:
Mike was pivotal in growing Spotad from a one man operation based in NYC, to a fully functional international organization including offices in San Francisco, The United Kingdom, and China. He was the galvanizer that allowed the business to reach profitability at such an early stage.  

Mike is nothing short of a hyper growth expert. He has a relentless and incredibly positive attitude, he commits fully to execution, and he doesn’t stop until he smashes past his goals. It is these characteristics that would make him an incredibly valuable asset to any organization that is lucky enough to work with him. 

Mike is also incredibly values driven. He has an innate sense of what is right, and will always do his utmost to ensure his work has a positive impact on those that it touches. 

Overall, I think very highly of Mike, and I enjoyed our time at Spotad immensely. I’d be happy to discuss specifics of our time together, so feel free to reach out to me directly if you wish to know any more.

peopleAlsoViewed.text: Senior Software Engineer, Distributed Systems at MongoDB
